member.name: T:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionOptions
member.summary: Provides the client configuration options for connecting to Azure Blob using clientside encryption.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionOptions.EncryptionVersion
member.summary: The version of clientside encryption to use.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionOptions.KeyEncryptionKey
member.summary: Required for upload operations. The key used to wrap the generated content encryption key. For more information, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-client-side-encryption.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionOptions.KeyResolver
member.summary: Required for download operations. Fetches the correct key encryption key to unwrap the downloaded content encryption key. For more information, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-client-side-encryption.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionOptions.KeyWrapAlgorithm
member.summary:
Required for upload operations. The algorithm identifier to use when wrapping the content encryption key. This is passed into
and its async counterpart.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionOptions.#ctor(Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionVersion)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The version of clientside encryption to use.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.ClientSideEncryptionVersion
member.summary: The version of clientside encryption to use.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder
member.summary:
is used to generate an account level Shared Access Signature (SAS) for Azure Storage services. For more information, see
Create an account SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.Version
member.summary: The storage service version to use to authenticate requests made with this shared access signature, and the service version to use when handling requests made with this shared access signature.
member.remarks: This property has been deprecated and we will always use the latest storage SAS version of the Storage service supported. This change does not have any impact on how your application generates or makes use of SAS tokens.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.Protocol
member.summary: The optional signed protocol field specifies the protocol permitted for a request made with the SAS. Possible values are , , and .

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.StartsOn
member.summary: Optionally specify the time at which the shared access signature becomes valid. If omitted when DateTimeOffset.MinValue is used, start time for this call is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.ExpiresOn
member.summary: The time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.Permissions
member.summary: The permissions associated with the shared access signature. The user is restricted to operations allowed by the permissions. The type can be used to create the permissions string.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.IPRange
member.summary: Specifies an IP address or a range of IP addresses from which to accept requests. If the IP address from which the request originates does not match the IP address or address range specified on the SAS token, the request is not authenticated. When specifying a range of IP addresses, note that the range is inclusive.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.Services
member.summary: The services associated with the shared access signature. The user is restricted to operations with the specified services.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.ResourceTypes
member.summary: The resource types associated with the shared access signature. The user is restricted to operations on the specified resources.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasBuilder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
This constructor has been deprecated. Please consider using
to create a Service SAS. This change does not have any impact on how your application generates or makes use of SAS tokens.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to create a Blob Container Service Sas.
member.param: The time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

Specifies the resource types accessible from an account level shared access signature.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasResourceTypes
member.summary: Specifies the resource types accessible from an account level shared access signature.

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasResourceTypes.Service
member.summary: Indicates whether service-level APIs are accessible from this shared access signature (e.g., Get/Set Service Properties, Get Service Stats, List Containers/Queues/Tables/ Shares).

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasResourceTypes.Container
member.summary: Indicates whether blob container-level APIs are accessible from this shared access signature (e.g., Create/Delete Container, Create/Delete Queue, Create/Delete Table, Create/Delete Share, List Blobs/Files and Directories).

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasResourceTypes.Object
member.summary: Indicates whether object-level APIs for blobs, queue messages, and files are accessible from this shared access signature (e.g. Put Blob, Query Entity, Get Messages, Create File, etc.).

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.AccountSasResourceTypes.All
member.summary: Indicates all service-level APIs are accessible from this shared access signature.

member.summary: Specifies the services accessible from an account level shared access signature.

member.summary: Indicates all services are accessible from the shared access signature.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasProtocol
member.summary: Defines the protocols permitted for Storage requests made with a shared access signature.

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasProtocol.None
member.summary: No protocol has been specified. If no value is specified, the service will default to HttpsAndHttp.

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasProtocol.HttpsAndHttp
member.summary: Only requests issued over HTTPS or HTTP will be permitted.

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasProtocol.Https
member.summary: Only requests issued over HTTPS will be permitted.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters
member.summary:
A object represents the components that make up an Azure Storage Shared Access Signature's query parameters. It includes components used by all Azure Storage resources (Blob Containers, Blobs, Files, and Queues). You can construct a new instance using the service specific SAS builder types. For more information,
Create a service SAS.

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.DefaultSasVersion
member.summary: The default service version to use for Shared Access Signatures.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Version
member.summary: Gets the storage service version to use to authenticate requests made with this shared access signature, and the service version to use when handling requests made with this shared access signature.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Services
member.summary: Gets the signed services accessible with an account level shared access signature.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.ResourceTypes
member.summary: Gets which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Protocol
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the protocol permitted for a request made with the shared access signature.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.StartsOn
member.summary: Gets the optional time at which the shared access signature becomes valid. If omitted, start time for this call is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request. means not set.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.ExpiresOn
member.summary: Gets the time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid. means not set.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.IPRange
member.summary: Gets the optional IP address or a range of IP addresses from which to accept requests. When specifying a range, note that the range is inclusive.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Identifier
member.summary: Gets the optional unique value up to 64 characters in length that correlates to an access policy specified for the blob container, queue, or share.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Resource
member.summary: Gets the resources are accessible via the shared access signature.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Permissions
member.summary: Gets the permissions associated with the shared access signature. The user is restricted to operations allowed by the permissions. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.CacheControl
member.summary: Gets the Cache-Control response header, which allows for specifying the client-side caching to be used for blob and file downloads.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets the Content-Disposition response header, which allows for specifying the way that the blob or file content can be displayed in the browser.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Gets the Content-Encoding response header, which allows for specifying the type of encoding used for blob and file downloads.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets the Content-Language response header, which allows for specifying the language of the downloaded blob or file content.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the Content-Type response header, which allows for specifying the type of the downloaded blob or file content.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.PreauthorizedAgentObjectId
member.summary: Gets the Authorized AAD Object Id associated with the shared access signature. The AAD Object ID of a user authorized by the owner of the User Delegation Key to perform the action granted by the SAS. The Azure Storage service will ensure that the owner of the user delegation key has the required permissions before granting access but no additional permission check for the user specified in this value will be performed. This cannot be used in conjuction with . Only valid in an HNS enabled account. If this value is set in an non-HNS enabled account, an authorization failure will be thrown.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.AgentObjectId
member.summary: Gets the Unauthorized AAD Object Id associated with the shared access signature. The AAD Object Id of a user that is assumed to be unauthorized by the owner of the User Delegation Key. The Azure Storage Service will perform an additional POSIX ACL check to determine if the user is authorized to perform the requested operation. This cannot be used in conjuction with . Only valid in an HNS enabled account. If this value is set in an non-HNS enabled account, an authorization failure will be thrown.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets the Correlation Id associated with the shared access signature. This is used to correlate the storage audit logs with the audit logs used by the principal generating and distributing SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.DirectoryDepth
member.summary: Gets the Directory Depth specificed in the canonicalizedresource field of the string-to-sign. The depth of the directory is the number of directories beneath the root folder. Required when resource (sr) = d to indicate the depth of the directory. The value must be a non-negative integer.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Signature
member.summary: Gets the string-to-sign, a unique string constructed from the fields that must be verified in order to authenticate the request. The signature is an HMAC computed over the string-to-sign and key using the SHA256 algorithm, and then encoded using Base64 encoding.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.SasQueryParameters.Empty
member.summary: Gets empty shared access signature query parameters.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type based on the supplied query parameters . All SAS-related query parameters will be removed from .

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.StorageExtensions
member.summary: Extensions and utilities for Azure Storage clients.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.StorageExtensions.CreateServiceTimeoutScope(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary:
Allows you to specify a server timeout for any Storage operations executing on this thread for the duration of the scope.
For more information, see
Setting timeouts for Blob service operations,
Setting timeouts for File service operations,
Setting timeouts for Queue service operations.
member.param: The server timeout for each HTTP request.
member.returns: The instance that needs to be disposed when server timeout shouldn't be used anymore.
member.remarks:
The server timeout is sent to the Azure Storage service for each REST request made within the scope. This value is not tracked or validated on the client, it is only passed to the Storage service.
Consider passing a to client methods and properly sizing when configuring storage clients as prefered way of enforcing upper boundary of execution time.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.StorageTransferOptions
member.summary: is used to provide options for parallel transfers.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.StorageTransferOptions.MaximumTransferLength
member.summary: The maximum length of an transfer in bytes. This property is a backwards-compatible facade for , which supports long values. Use for full access of supported values.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.StorageTransferOptions.MaximumTransferSize
member.summary: The maximum length of an transfer in bytes.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.StorageTransferOptions.MaximumConcurrency
member.summary: The maximum number of workers that may be used in a parallel transfer.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.StorageTransferOptions.InitialTransferLength
member.summary: The size of the first range request in bytes. Blobs smaller than this limit will be downloaded in a single request. Blobs larger than this limit will continue being downloaded in chunks of size . This property is a backwards-compatible facade for , which supports long values. Use for full access of supported values.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.StorageTransferOptions.InitialTransferSize
member.summary: The size of the first range request in bytes. Blobs smaller than this limit will be downloaded in a single request. Blobs larger than this limit will continue being downloaded in chunks of size .

member.name: F:Azure.Storage.Constants.BlockNameFormat

member.summary: Get the account name from the domain portion of a Uri.
member.param: The service subdomain used to validate that the domain is in the expected format. This should be "blob" for blobs, "file" for files, "queue" for queues, "blob" and "dfs" for datalake.
member.returns: Account name or null if not able to be parsed.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.UriExtensions.GetAccountNameFromDomain(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the account name from the host.
member.param: The service subdomain used to validate that the domain is in the expected format. This should be "blob" for blobs, "file" for files, "queue" for queues, "blob" and "dfs" for datalake.
member.returns: Account name or null if not able to be parsed.
